articles.headline: Bridging a Digital Divide That Leaves Schoolchildren Behind
articles.snippet: The Federal Communications Commission is expected to vote soon on a plan that could add subsidies for broadband Internet services in low-income homes.
articles.abstract: The Federal Communications Commission is expected to vote soon on a plan that could add subsidies for broadband Internet services in low-income homes.
articles.lead_paragraph: McALLEN, Tex. — At 7 p.m. on a recent Wednesday, Isabella and Tony Ruiz were standing in their usual homework spot, on a crumbling sidewalk across the street from the elementary school nearest to their home.

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Fires Top Aide Rick Tyler Over Misleading Video Attacking Marco Rubio
articles.snippet: Senator Ted Cruz fired his communications director on Monday after the aide acknowledged spreading a false story that purported to show his main rival, Senator Marco Rubio, questioning the answers that the Bible provides.
articles.abstract: Senator Ted Cruz fired his communications director on Monday after the aide acknowledged spreading a false story that purported to show his main rival, Senator Marco Rubio, questioning the answers that the Bible provides.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here’s how we analyzed in real time the Republican Nevada caucuses.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: A New Breed of Trader on Wall Street: Coders With a Ph.D.
articles.snippet: In the world of exchange-traded funds, a $2.8 trillion industry, Jane Street takes the marriage of high tech and high intellect to a new level.
articles.abstract: In the world of exchange-traded funds, a $2.8 trillion industry, Jane Street takes the marriage of high tech and high intellect to a new level.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOLLYWOOD, Fla. — The mood in the markets may be getting grimmer, but in the booming world of exchange-traded funds, people just want to party.

articles.headline: Xi Jinping’s News Alert: Chinese Media Must Serve the Party
articles.snippet: In visits to state news organizations on Friday, the president reiterated his policy, and he wants to curb the presence of foreign media companies.
articles.abstract: In visits to state news organizations on Friday, the president reiterated his policy, and he wants to curb the presence of foreign media companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Chinese news media covered President Xi Jinping’s most recent public appearances with adulation befitting a demigod.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Asks If Faulty Blood Monitor Tainted Xarelto Approval
articles.snippet: A legal brief says Johnson & Johnson has been asked whether Alere’s recalled INRatio blood-testing monitor compromised the anticlotting drug’s trial.
articles.abstract: A legal brief says Johnson & Johnson has been asked whether Alere’s recalled INRatio blood-testing monitor compromised the anticlotting drug’s trial.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration is investigating whether a faulty blood-testing device may have compromised the results of a clinical trial that led to the approval of Xarelto, a blockbuster anticlotting drug that has been prescribed to millions of Americans since it arrived on the market in 2011.

articles.headline: Legionnaires’ Outbreak in Flint Was Met With Silence
articles.snippet: An examination of government emails and interviews shows a failure to act swiftly to address a dangerous health problem or warn the public.
articles.abstract: An examination of government emails and interviews shows a failure to act swiftly to address a dangerous health problem or warn the public.
articles.lead_paragraph: FLINT, Mich. — It was the Fourth of July, a warm summer night in 2014, but Tim Monahan was shivering in a thick blanket as he watched fireworks from his front yard here. By the next afternoon his temperature had shot to 104.6, and doctors at the hospital he had checked into puzzled over what was wrong.

articles.headline: Norwegian Air Flies in the Face of the Trans-Atlantic Establishment
articles.snippet: Norwegian Air Shuttle has quietly established a beachhead in the trans-Atlantic market by offering low-fare, no-frills service on long-haul flights.
articles.abstract: Norwegian Air Shuttle has quietly established a beachhead in the trans-Atlantic market by offering low-fare, no-frills service on long-haul flights.
articles.lead_paragraph: First there was Laker Airways. Then there was People Express. Both airlines shared a similar, if ultimately unsuccessful, goal: to bring low fares to the trans-Atlantic market.

articles.headline: For Apple, a Search for a Moral High Ground in a Heated Debate
articles.snippet: Is the company’s primary moral obligation to the help the government, protect its customers’ privacy or maximize profits for its shareholders?
articles.abstract: Is the company’s primary moral obligation to the help the government, protect its customers’ privacy or maximize profits for its shareholders?
articles.lead_paragraph: What does it mean to be a good corporate citizen?

articles.headline: Russia Wants Closer Look From Above the U.S.
articles.snippet: Russia has requested to upgrade the cameras it uses on sanctioned surveillance flights across the United States, which are part of a treaty.
articles.abstract: Russia has requested to upgrade the cameras it uses on sanctioned surveillance flights across the United States, which are part of a treaty.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Russia asked on Monday to fly surveillance planes equipped with high-powered digital cameras over the United States, fueling a long-simmering debate among Pentagon and intelligence officials over Russia’s intentions to use such flights to spy on American power plants, communications networks and other critical infrastructure.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: Lack of Videos Hampers Inquiries Into Houston Police Shootings
articles.snippet: There have been dozens of questionable shootings of unarmed people during the past decade, none of which led to criminal prosecution.
articles.abstract: There have been dozens of questionable shootings of unarmed people during the past decade, none of which led to criminal prosecution.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — If the police shooting of Omar Ventura on a February night five years ago had been captured on video, it would have been chilling to watch.

articles.headline: Obama Sends Plan to Close Guantánamo to Congress
articles.snippet: The president has long worked to empty the prison in Cuba, which he calls a counterproductive symbol of American power.
articles.abstract: The president has long worked to empty the prison in Cuba, which he calls a counterproductive symbol of American power.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama sent Congress a plan on Tuesday to close the United States military prison at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, his latest attempt to deliver on an unfulfilled promise of his presidency, which faces near-certain rejection by Congress.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Julie Hirschfeld Davis
